column1: james douglas webb| james douglas webb
column4: died at 3:04 am wednesday at his residence. the bowling green native was a son of the late goebel william webb and eula mae caldwell webb. he was preceded in death by his wife
column5: helen hardcastle webb and a sister
column6: margie west. mr. webb was retired from the united states air force holding the rank of master sergeant and having served in wwii
column7: korea and viet nam. he was a member of the masonic lodge and the shriners. he was a kentucky colonel and a lifelong baptist. funeral services are scheduled for 12:00 pm
column8: friday at johnson-vaughn-phelps funeral home with burial in fairview cemetery. visitation will be from 3:00 pm to 8:00 pm thursday and again from 10:00 am to 12:00 pm friday at johnson-vaughn-phelps funeral home. survivors include two daughters
column9: sandra webb and tammy stearman (andy) all of bowling green; three grandchildren brittany stearman
column10: lacey stearman and james zachary stearman all of bowling green. expressions of sympathy may take the form of contributions to the bowling green/warren county humane society.
